item.title: Abandoned Ford KA, 19th January
item.description:
Abandoned ford KA, no tax since December 2025, no MOT since November 2025. It's also parked on the curb! For the residents of St Margarets Grove, please remove it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Margarets Grove, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Blue Mercedes Kompressor, 19th January
item.description:
Abandoned car, hasn't moved for over 12 months. Has had a flat tyre and the MOT ran out in September 2025! Many residents of St Margarets Grove have reported the car ( and many more) through the same channel but nothing has been done about it! It's becoming more and more difficult for residents to park on our own street. It really doesn't help that someone is keeping multiple cars on our road and leaving them in disrepair.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Margarets Grove, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakeside Close, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle with no MOT and expired TfL Private Hire Vehicle Licence on Vambery Road, outside house numbers 1 - 3, 19th January
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked outside No's 1-3 Vambery Road SE18 3HA for more than 6 weeks. It has flat tyres, an expired MOT, no SORN in accordance with the GOV.uk website and an expired TfL Private Vehicle Hire. We have asked residents of Vambery Road and neighbouring roads if they know the owner of the vehicle and so far no residents know who owns the vehicle. The abandon vehicle has been reported to the Met Police as well. It is taking up a resident parking space on a public highway.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vambery Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a problem in the road at this bus stop, 19th January
item.description:
The drain at this bus stop has sunk and the road surface around the drain has also subsided, it is cracked resulting in a huge pothole and a large amount of surface debris being dragged along Westmoreland Road. It is extremely dangerous to drivers and cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmoreland Road, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43-44, Beauchamp Place, Chelsea, Greater London

item.title: Littering & Graffiti Havil Street Flat first floor, 19th January
item.description:
Has been here 2-3 weeks, on going issue, communal areas not respected or cleaned. This is the last block of Havil street before Southampton way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyover the A2 / black prince, 19th January
item.description:
Yes the potholes and road surface on the flyover A2 Black prince is get worse as the potholes are now deeper and wider since it was reported to your traffic management a few weeks ago and still nothing has been done. TM need to schedule a plan to improve the road service on the whole flyover and stop doing temporary repairs, also deal with the poor drainage on the roundabout when coming down from gavel hill again this has been reported recently and still no improvements. Could be arranged to have the blue bottle carrier to be removed that’s in the middle of the carriageway as it’s been there for a few months as l am sure your staff drive over the flyover every days
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
